channel.title: Changing the IP SERVERSIDE
channel.description: I need to change the default IP to my IP so my server can run online. I changed it clientside. But when I run my server I get: "Server listening on port 0.0.0.0:43594" I have everything portforwarded. Obviously nobody could ever connect to me through 0.0.0.0. So how can I change the default 0.0.0.0 to my IP? Now that you've read the stupid part of the post... Let me explain the actual problem. I am running exion and I have searched the client.java serverside 1000 times and there is NO WHERE to change the IP. You do not know how fucking annoying it is. PLEASE do not comment on this with useless posts trying to explain to me how everything works. I only need solutions, I know how portforwarding, No-IP, and all that works. Thank you!

item.title: Changing the IP SERVERSIDE
item.dc:creator: @T0xicsnip3r T0xicsnip3r
item.description:
@T0xicsnip3r wrote:

all you have to do is open up your client , and go to client.java , then u hit control f , and search for " server = " make sure u have space inbetween server and = . then u change this to 127.0.0.1 then u make u make a 2nd client for ur players to play and instead of putting 127.0.0.1 you put your no-ip … this is what it shud look like.
public client() {
tabHPos = -1;
alertHandler = new AlertHandler(this);
fullscreenInterfaceID = -1;
chatRights = new int[500];
chatTypeView = 0;
clanChatMode = 0;
cButtonHPos = -1;
cButtonHCPos = -1;
cButtonCPos = 0;
server = “127.0.0.1”; <---------- change that to for example server = “vaginascape.no-ip.biz” or
whatever your no-ip is. then you compile and you rightclick the client for players to use and hit "add to (name of the client folder) and it makes a rar file and you upload that to mediafire or gamefront or any website for people to download it off of. also make sure if you dont have auto cache downloader for players that you put your cache in the folder , make sure u right click it and do “add to cache” and get a winrar file , just leave that in the client folder that u upload and tell them to extract that to there C Drive.

Also when it says server listening on port 0.0.0.0 43594 , that doesnt matter . i changed mine to 127.0.0.1 43594 but it doesnt matter , only thing that matters is the 43594. You Do nothing in your source , but you need to leave your source running 24/7 for ur server to be on 24/7 so players can connect. if ur source isnt running server will be off

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the IP SERVERSIDE
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Check out canyouseeme.org, it will tell you what’s up with your port.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the IP SERVERSIDE
item.dc:creator: @Taren Taren
item.description:
@Taren wrote:

That’s what I originally knew, some idiot lied to me this whole time!!! IM ANGRY!!! So I’m guessing my portforwarding is not configured correctly?

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the IP SERVERSIDE
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

You DON’T I repeat, YOU DO NOT, change the IP server sided. The server does not connect to an IP, it binds to a port.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing the IP SERVERSIDE
item.dc:creator: @Taren Taren
item.description:
@Taren wrote:

I need to change the default IP to my IP so my server can run online.
I changed it clientside.
But when I run my server I get: “Server listening on port 0.0.0.0:43594”
I have everything portforwarded.
Obviously nobody could ever connect to me through 0.0.0.0. So how can I change the default 0.0.0.0 to my IP?
Now that you’ve read the stupid part of the post… Let me explain the actual problem. I am running exion and I have searched the client.java serverside 1000 times and there is NO WHERE to change the IP. You do not know how fucking annoying it is. PLEASE do not comment on this with useless posts trying to explain to me how everything works. I only need solutions, I know how portforwarding, No-IP, and all that works.
Thank you!
